key_actions.description: Ensure the honey container is ready, with the cap or lid removed if necessary.
Hold the honey container above the salad, ensuring proper alignment to avoid spilling.
Slowly tilt the honey container to begin pouring the honey onto the salad.
Adjust the angle of the container to regulate the flow of honey, ensuring an even distribution.
Once the desired amount of honey is poured, return the container to its upright position.
Secure the cap or lid back on the honey container after pouring to prevent spillage.

sensory_inputs.description: Used to monitor the positioning of the honey container and ensure the honey is directed onto the salad.
Helps feel the weight and consistency of the honey as it begins to pour and adjust the pressure if needed.
Provides feedback from the hands to adjust the tilt of the container for controlled pouring.
Hearing the sound of honey flowing can help gauge the amount being poured.
